intro: Crotalaria stacyana, commonly known as the scarlet burr medic, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and spiny pods. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, and the plant is often used in forage and soil improvement due to its nitrogen-fixing ability. However, it can be invasive in some areas, posing challenges to local ecosystems.
